briefdescription.para: A vector of Matrix2D objects representing the storage-to-ROF tables for each utility.
A vector of integers representing the IDs of all online downstream sources.
A boolean array indicating whether a source has downstream sources.
The number of topological sources in the system.
A flag indicating whether pre-computer ROF tables are being used.
An integer representing the beginning tier for ROF table calculation.
A vector of WaterSource pointers representing the water sources in the realization.
A vector of Utility pointers representing the utilities in the realization.
A vector of Matrix2D objects representing the storage-to-ROF tables for each utility.
A 2D vector of doubles representing the shifts in storage-to-ROF tables for each utility.
A 2D vector of doubles representing the shifts in base storage-to-ROF tables for each utility.
A 2D vector of doubles representing the shifts in treatment demand buffer for each utility.
A vector of doubles representing the utilities' base storage capacities.
A vector of doubles representing the utilities' base delta capacities.
A vector of doubles representing the utilities' current and base storage capacity ratios.
A vector of doubles representing the utilities' current storage table shifts.
A vector of doubles representing the utilities' current base storage table shifts.
A vector of doubles representing the utilities' current demand ratio buffers.

memberdef.argsstring: (vector< WaterSource *> water_sources, const Graph &water_sources_graph, const vector< vector< int >> &water_sources_to_utilities, vector< Utility *> utilities, vector< MinEnvFlowControl *> min_env_flow_controls, vector< double > &utilities_rdm, vector< double > &water_sources_rdm, unsigned long total_weeks_simulation, const int use_precomputed_rof_tables, const unsigned long realization_id)
memberdef.name: ContinuityModelROF

briefdescription.para: Initializes the ContinuityModelROF object for simulating risks of failure (ROF).

detaileddescription.para: This constructor sets up the ContinuityModelROF by initializing storage structures, updating utilities' total available volume, and preparing risk-of-failure (ROF) tables or calculations based on pre-computed data.

parameterdescription.para: Vector of water source objects used in the model.
Graph representing the topological relationships between water sources.
Mapping of water sources to utilities.
Vector of utility objects to manage water demand and allocation.
Vector of minimum environmental flow controls.
Vector of random deviations for utilities.
Vector of random deviations for water sources.
Total number of weeks for the simulation.
Indicator for using pre-computed ROF tables (1: use, 0: generate dynamically).
Unique identifier for the simulation realization.

briefdescription.para: Destructor for the ContinuityModelROF class.

detaileddescription.para: This function cleans up resources allocated during the lifetime of the ContinuityModelROF object. Specifically, it releases memory associated with dynamically allocated arrays.

briefdescription.para: This function calculates the short-term risk of failure (ROF) for all utilities.

detaileddescription.para: Depending on whether precomputed ROF tables are imported, the function either performs calculations using the tables or calculates the ROF values directly.

parameterdescription.para: The current week in the simulation for which the short-term ROF is being calculated.

Indicator for using precomputed ROF tables:
IMPORT_ROF_TABLES: Use precomputed ROF tables.
Any other value: Perform full calculations for ROF.

simplesect.para: A 2D vector of doubles where each row corresponds to a utility, and columns represent ROF values based on different storage or demand conditions.

briefdescription.para: This function performs a full calculation of the short-term risk of failure (ROF) for each utility for the given week.

detaileddescription.para: The calculation considers both storage and treatment failure risks over a series of realizations. It simulates the system behavior for multiple years, adjusting for failures based on available storage and treatment capacity.

parameterdescription.para: The current week of the simulation to calculate the short-term ROF for.

simplesect.para:
A 2D vector of doubles representing the risk of failure for each utility:
The first row corresponds to storage-related ROF.
The second row corresponds to treatment-related ROF.

parameterdescription.para: If NaN values are encountered in the ROF calculations for storage or treatment.

simplesect.para: updateStorageToROFTable, resetUtilitiesAndReservoirs, updateOnlineInfrastructure, setInitialTableTier, recordROFStorageTable, calculateEmptyVolumes

memberdef.argsstring: (int week, vector< Utility *> utilities, vector< double > utilities_base_storage_capacity, const vector< Matrix2D< double >> &ut_storage_to_rof_table, vector< double > current_storage_table_shift, vector< double > current_base_storage_table_shift, vector< double > current_demand_ratio_buffer)
memberdef.name: calculateShortTermROFTable

briefdescription.para: This function calculates the short-term risk of failure (ROF) for each utility based on the current storage levels and treatment capacity ratios, using a predefined ROF table.

detaileddescription.para: The function estimates the risk of failure in both storage and treatment for each utility by comparing the current storage levels against the storage-to-ROF table. It also checks if the demand-to-treatment capacity ratio exceeds a threshold to flag potential treatment failures.

parameterdescription.para: The current week of the simulation for which the short-term ROF should be calculated.
The list of utilities for which the ROF will be calculated.
The base storage capacities of each utility.
The precomputed storage-to-ROF table for each utility.
The current shift applied to the storage table for each utility.
The current shift applied to the base storage table for each utility.
The buffer added to the demand-to-treatment capacity ratio to avoid early failure triggers.

simplesect.para:
A 2D vector of doubles representing the risk of failure for each utility:
The first row corresponds to the storage-related ROF.
The second row corresponds to the treatment-related ROF.

briefdescription.para: This function calculates the long-term risk of failure (ROF) for each utility, considering both storage and treatment capacity, based on projected demand and predefined failure thresholds.

detaileddescription.para: The function performs a long-term simulation of the utilities' storage and treatment capacities over a series of realizations and time steps, calculating the risk of failure for each utility based on storage and treatment conditions.

parameterdescription.para: The current week of the simulation for which the long-term ROF should be calculated.

simplesect.para:
A 2D vector of doubles representing the risk of failure for each utility:
The first row corresponds to the storage-related ROF.
The second row corresponds to the treatment-related ROF.

briefdescription.para: Resets the utilities' and reservoirs' storage, last release, and combined storage respectively for the specified risk of failure (ROF) type.

detaileddescription.para: This function updates the water sources' available volumes and outflows based on the current ROF type (short-term or long-term). It also updates the total available volume for each utility.

parameterdescription.para:
The type of ROF being simulated. Can be either:
SHORT_TERM_ROF: For resetting to current storage conditions.
LONG_TERM_ROF: For resetting to full capacity conditions.

briefdescription.para: Connects this specific realization's water sources to the model by passing the water sources to the ROF continuity model for the specific realization it calculated ROFs for.

detaileddescription.para: This function assigns the provided vector of water sources to the realization's water sources. It updates the internal realization_water_sources vector to reflect the current simulation state.

parameterdescription.para: A vector containing the one realization's water sources to be connected to the model.

briefdescription.para: Connects the realization utilities to the model by passing in the locations of the utilities of the realization it calculated ROFs for.

detaileddescription.para: This function assigns the provided vector of utilities to the realization's utilities. It updates the internal realization_utilities vector to reflect the current simulation state.

parameterdescription.para: A vector containing the utilities to be connected to the model.

briefdescription.para: Updates the online infrastructure for water sources and utilities.

detaileddescription.para: This function checks for any new infrastructure that has become online in the realization model and updates the corresponding infrastructure status in the continuity model (ROF model). It updates water sources' capacities, utilities' storage capacities, and their ratios to status-quo capacities. It also updates the list of downstream sources for each source.

parameterdescription.para: The current week number for the simulation.

briefdescription.para: Updates the approximate storage-to-ROF table based on the available water volumes and failure conditions.

detaileddescription.para: This function updates the storage-to-ROF table for each week by shifting storage volumes and checking for utility failures at various storage levels. The function reduces storage levels incrementally and records failures for utilities that do not meet the required storage capacity ratio. The process stops once all utilities have failed at a particular storage level.

parameterdescription.para: The percentage decrement to apply to the storage levels.
The week of the year to update the table for.
Array of available water volumes to full storage capacity for each water source.

briefdescription.para: Shifts storage volumes based on delta values.

detaileddescription.para: This function adjusts the storage volumes of water sources according to the given delta values. It handles the spillover of water to downstream sources if a source's storage exceeds its capacity. The function is designed to respect the topological order of sources, ensuring that upstream sources are processed before downstream sources.
FIXME: MAKE THIS MORE EFFICIENT. THIS METHOD IS THE MOST EXPENSIVE ONE IN THE CODE.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an array representing the shifted available volumes for each water source.
A pointer to an array of delta values representing the change in storage for each water source.

briefdescription.para: Prints the ROF table to CSV files for each utility.

detaileddescription.para: FIXME: This is where changes from CSV to more efficient file formats should be made.

This function generates CSV files containing the Risk of Failure (ROF) data for each utility. It iterates over the number of utilities and writes the ROF table data to a separate file for each utility. The files are saved in the specified folder with filenames indicating the realization ID and the utility index.

parameterdescription.para: The folder path where the CSV files will be saved.

memberdef.argsstring: (const vector< Matrix2D< double >> &storage_to_rof_table, const vector< vector< double >> &table_storage_shift, const vector< vector< double >> &table_base_storage_shift, const vector< vector< double >> &treatment_demand_buffer_shift)
memberdef.name: setROFTablesAndShifts

briefdescription.para: Sets the ROF tables and shifts for the model.

detaileddescription.para: This function assigns the provided ROF tables and related shift data to the corresponding member variables in the model. The shift data is used for adjusting the storage and demand conditions during the ROF calculation processes.

parameterdescription.para: The 2D matrix of storage-to-ROF data.
The shift values for the storage table.
The shift values for the base storage table.
The shift values for the treatment demand buffer.

briefdescription.para: Handles exceptions related to ROF table extrapolation or errors during ROF calculations.

detaileddescription.para: This function throws an exception if the ROF tables need to be extrapolated due to a utility's current capacity exceeding the table's base capacity. If the error is related to table extrapolation, it provides guidance to regenerate tables with adjusted parameters. If the error occurs in a different context, a runtime exception is thrown with the appropriate details.

parameterdescription.para: The ratio of current storage capacity to the base storage capacity.
The index of the utility where the exception occurred.
The current week in the simulation where the error occurred.
If m is greater than 1, indicating that the current capacity is greater than the table base capacity.
For other exceptions that occur within a specific week for a utility.

memberdef.argsstring: (int week, const int &utilities, vector< Matrix2D< double >> &vector, int &tier)
memberdef.name: setInitialTableTier

briefdescription.para: Sets the initial table tier based on the failure conditions for utilities at a specific week.

detaileddescription.para: This function determines the initial table tier by checking for failures across utilities and adjusting the tier accordingly. It searches through the storage to ROF table and identifies the first tier where no failures occurred, setting that as the beginning tier for the simulation.

parameterdescription.para: The current week in the simulation.
The number of utilities to be considered in the table.
The table containing storage to ROF data for utilities.
The tier to be set as the starting point for the calculations.

memberdef.argsstring: (vector< Matrix2D< double >> &ut_storage_to_rof_rof_realization, vector< Matrix2D< double >> &ut_storage_to_rof_table, const int &n_utilities, int &week, int &week_of_the_year)
memberdef.name: recordROFStorageTable

briefdescription.para: Records the risk of failure (ROF) storage table data for a given utility and week.

detaileddescription.para: This function updates the ut_storage_to_rof_table by adding ROF data for each utility at the specified week. The ROF data is retrieved from the corresponding realization table, averaged over all realizations, and then added to the storage table for that week.

parameterdescription.para: The ROF data for all utilities across multiple realizations.
The storage to ROF table to which the data is to be added.
The number of utilities being considered.
The current week in the simulation.
The specific week of the year to record data for.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the empty volume for each water source. This information is later used for updating the ROF tables.

detaileddescription.para: This function calculates the empty volume (the volume required to fill a water source to its capacity) for each water source in the realization_water_sources list. The calculation is based on the supply capacity and the available volume for each source. If a water source is offline, the empty volume is set to zero.

parameterdescription.para: A list of water sources to calculate empty volumes for.
An array where the empty volume for each water source will be stored.

briefdescription.para: Updates treatment allocations for joint water treatment plants.

detaileddescription.para: This function updates the treatment allocations for water sources of type NEW_JOINT_WATER_TREATMENT_PLANT in the non_rof_water_sources list. It ensures that the treatment allocations are synchronized between the continuity and realization water sources if the source is online.
FIXME: WHAT IS THE FUNCTIONAL DIFFERENCE BETWEEN WATER_SOURCES VECTORS HERE?

parameterdescription.para: A list of non-ROF water sources whose treatment allocations will be updated.

briefdescription.para: Updates treatment capacities for utilities.

detaileddescription.para: This function updates the treatment capacities for utilities in the non_rof_utilities list by synchronizing the treatment capacities between the continuity and realization utilities.
FIXME: WHAT IS THE FUNCTIONAL DIFFERENCE BETWEEN WATER_SOURCES VECTORS HERE?

parameterdescription.para: A list of non-ROF utilities whose treatment capacities will be updated.

briefdescription.para: Retrieves the storage-to-ROF table.

detaileddescription.para: This function returns a reference to the storage-to-ROF table, which contains the calculated risk of failure (ROF) for each utility at various storage levels.

simplesect.para: A reference to the storage-to-ROF table (ut_storage_to_rof_table).
